title: Optimised Method for the Production and Titration of Lentiviral Vectors Pseudotyped with the SARS-CoV-2 Spike
procedures:
Spike LV production by transient transfectionDay 1: Cell seeding Seed 2.0 × 106 cells HEK293T/17 cells per 10 cm plate in 10 ml of culturing media supplemented with 2 mM L-glutamine and 10% FCS aiming for 80% confluence on day of transfection.Day 3: Transfection Prepare two sterile 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes labeled Tube 1 and Tube 2.Add 5.56 µg of pCMVR8.74, 2.77 µg of pCDNA-SARS-CoV-2-S(D614G)ΔERR, and 4.17 µg of pCCL.SFFV.eGFP, for a total of 12.5 µg of DNA, to Tube 1 (equivalent to 2:1:1.5 plasmid ratios for scalable production).Prepare the transfection mixture in Tube 2, as shown in Table 1.Table 1. Transient transfection mixture.table:

Reagents,μl/10 cm plate
Gene Juice,30
OptiMEM®,470

Mix GeneJuice/OptiMEM® transfection mixture using a pipette and incubate for 5 min at room temperature.Pipette 500 µl of transfection mixture into tube containing the plasmid constructs (Tube 1) and gently mix solution five times using the same pipette, avoiding the formation bubbles.Incubate solution for 15 min at room temperature.Pipette the DNA/GeneJuice/OptiMEM solution onto HEK293T/17 cells in a dropwise manner throughout the total surface of the plate.Place plate in an incubator at 37 °C with 5% CO2 for 16-18 h.Day 4: Media change Carefully remove the culture media from plate 16-18 h post-transfection.Slowly add 7 ml of fresh culturing media supplemented with 2 mM L-glutamine and 10% FCS by pipetting media to one side of the plate to avoid detachment of cells.Place plate back in the incubator at 37 °C with 5% CO2 for 16-18 h.Day 5: Viral supernatant harvesting Harvest the viral supernatant containing the lentiviral vector pseudotyped with SARS-CoV-2-S(D614G)ΔERR into a 15 ml falcon previously chilled by either placing it in the fridge or on wet ice for 10 min.Centrifuge at 400 × g for 5 min to remove cellular debris.Clarify viral supernatant with 0.45 µm microfiltration to remove viral aggregates.To avoid multiple freeze-thaw cycles, aliquot viral supernatants into 0.2-0.5 ml aliquots in sterile 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes with screw caps.For later use, snap-freeze vials using dry ice and ethanol before storing them at -80 °C.For immediate use, store vials on ice until needed.Spike-LV titration by infectivity assayDay 1: Seeding permissive cells in a 24-well plate:Pre-warm IMDM containing 10% FCS, 1% GlutaMAX, and 1 µg/ml Puromycin. This will be referred to as culturing media.Harvest stable HEK293T/17-hACE2+TMPRSS2+ cells previously thawed and cultured for at least two passages (with the addition of 1 µg/ml Puromycin from the first passage after thawing) (Figure S1) as follows:Remove and discard cellular supernatant.

Gently wash cells by pipetting 5 ml of PBS to remove any excess culturing media.Add 3 ml of Cell dissociation buffer Enzyme-free PBS-based to the flask and incubate for 5 min.Gently tap the sides of the flask to prompt cell detachment.Add 7 ml of culturing media to flask, collect cells, and pipette into a new falcon.Centrifuge at 400 × g for 5 min.Discard supernatant and flick falcon with finger to gently dislodge cellular pellet.Resuspend the cells by adding 5 ml of culturing media.Determine cell density:Passage cells by platting 1:6-1:8 of resuspended cells in a new T75 flask with 9 ml of culturing media, with a recommended minimum seeding of 3.3 × 104 cells/cm2.Proceed to Step 1c for titration cell seeding.Determine cell density using an Automated cell Analyzer NucleoCounter® NC-250TM.Resuspend cells at 5.0 × 104cells/ml in 8 ml per viral vector supernatant to be quantified by titration.Add 0.88 µl/ml of polybrene to resuspended cells; the final volume in each well will be 1.1 ml, leading to a final concentration of 8 µg/ml of polybrene.Mix the resuspended cells and plate 1 ml/well in a total of seven wells (six wells for vector infection and one well for a no-vector control).Add 1 ml of PBS to remaining unoccupied wells.Preparing Spike LV dilutions for infection of permissive cells:If using frozen Spike-LV, thaw in a water bath set at 37 °C and immediately use. If using fresh Spike-LV placed on ice, mix viral vectors by pipetting a few times, avoiding the formation of bubbles.In a V-bottom 96-well plate, prepare the following 1:4 serial dilutions of Spike-LV in pre-chilled culture media for six points:Pipette 200 µl of Spike-LV into one well in the V-bottom plate (e.g., well A1).Pipette 150 µl of pre-chilled complete IMDM into five every other well in V-bottom plate (e.g.

, wells A3, A5, A7, A9, and A11).Tip: Using every other well on the plate allows moving between 96-well plates and 24-well plates using a multichannel pipette (see Figure 1). imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/e4034/bioprotoc---4034-g001.jpgFigure 1. Transfer between 96-well and 24-well plates Move 50 µl from the first well (A1) containing Spike-LV into the subsequent well (A3).Gently mix with a pipette ten times, being careful to avoid the formation of bubbles.Move onto the third well (A5) and continue the serial dilution until reaching the 6th well (A11).Using a multichannel with every other tip occupied, pipette 100 μl of vector dilutions to each well of HEK293T/17-hACE2+TMPRSS2+ cells already plated in a 24-well plate (Figure 1). Centrifuge the plate at 1,000 × g for 20 min to enhance transduction by spinoculation.Place plate back in the incubator at 37 °C with 5% CO2 for 72 h.Day 3: Determining transduction efficiency and titer calculation Discard culture media by flicking 24-well plate into a laboratory box that can be subsequently disinfected or a laboratory sink if the correct risk assessments are in place. Blot the plate on paper to remove excess liquid.Add 200 μl/well of cell dissociation buffer and incubate for 10 min.Gently tap the plate to detach cells.Add 400 μl of PBS/well, resuspend cells by pipetting, and harvest 200 μl into a new V-bottom 96-well plate.Tip: Using every other well on the plate allows moving between 96-well plates and 24-well plates using a multichannel pipette (Figure 1). Centrifuge the plate at 400 × g for 5 min.Discard supernatant by quickly flicking plate in an appropriate manner (see step 1) and blot on paper to remove excess liquid.Add 250 μl PBS/well and centrifuge plate at 400 × g for 5 min.In the meantime, prepare a master mix for Fixable Viability Dye eFluorTM 780 (0.1 µl + 99.

9 µl PBS/well).Discard supernatant by quickly flicking plate in an appropriate manner (see step 1) and blot on paper to remove excess liquid.Resuspend cells in 100 µl /well staining master mix.Incubate at room temperature for 30 min in the dark.Add 150 μl PBS/well and centrifuge plate at 400 × g for 5 min.Discard PBS, blot plate, and resuspend cells in 50 μl of PBS using P200 tips.Acquire plate on flow cytometer with the following bandpass filters:RL2 780/60 for Fixable Viability Dye eFluorTM 780.BL1 530/60 for fluorescent marker of transduction, eGFP.Note: If the user is unfamiliar with flow cytometric analysis of cells, it is advisable that a trained flow cytometry operator assists from this step onward.
